column1: A percutaneous transhepatic cholangiogram (PTCA) is an x-ray of the bile ducts.
The test is performed in a radiology department by a radiologist.
Tell your provider if you are taking any blood thinners such as warfarin (coumadin), Plavix (clopidrogrel), Pradaxa, or Xarelto.
A blockage of the bile duct can lead to jaundice (yellow discoloration of the skin), itching of the skin, or infection of the liver, gallbladder or pancreas.
It may also indicate cancer in the bile ducts, liver, pancreas, or region of the gallbladder.
There is also a small risk of: - Damage to nearby organs - Excessive blood loss - Blood poisoning (sepsis) - Inflammation of the bile ducts
A magnetic resonance cholangiopancreatography (MRCP) is a newer, noninvasive imaging method, based on MRI.
